tool_name: Article Data Extraction and Text Mining
tool_description: Ujeebu Article Extraction API extracts clean text, and other structured data from news and blog articles.
title: Article Data Extraction and Text Mining

api_list.name: /v1.1/card
api_list.description: Extract a preview of an article (article card). This is faster than the extract endpoint as it doesn't do any in-depth analysis of the content of the article, and instead mostly relies on its meta tags.

parameters.name: js_timeout
parameters.description: when JavaScript is enabled, indicates how many seconds the API should wait for the JS interpreter before starting the extraction.

parameters.name: js
parameters.description: indicates whether to execute JavaScript or not.

utterances.utterance: Can you extract a preview of the article from this URL: https://thenextweb.com/news/pixel-6-teaser?
Get a quick preview of the article at https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-56713017.
I'd like a summary of the article found at https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/01/world/climate-change-report/index.html.
Please extract the main points from this article: https://www.forbes.com/sites/johnkoetsier/2023/09/30/ai-revolution-in-healthcare.
Can you provide a preview of the content at https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/02/business/economy/us-economy.html?
I'd like to see a brief overview of the article located at https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/01/global-warming-impact.
Extract a summary from the article at https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/10/01/social-media-impact-study.
Can you give me a quick rundown of the article at https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-10-01/stock-market-trends.
Please provide a preview of the article from https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/2023/10/01/global-markets-overview.
I'd like a brief summary of the article at https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/2023-10-01-international-relations-update.

api_list.name: /v1.1/extract

article.text:
Why do we care so much about what others think?
Why does it feel so damn weird to put ourselves out there?
Why does the prospect of being rejected fill us with weird vibes?
Why do we fight so hard to protect our cool, relaxed, totally not boring, happy images?
Because we’re human.
Because we don’t want to be rejected by ‘society.’
Because we want to survive.
Because it’s understandable and normal to try and look and act flawlessly.
…
The only teenie weenie issue with this is that it makes us miserable.
…
We can never relax if there is the chance that we will look stupid.
We can never just ‘be ourselves.’
So how the hell can we just relax?
How can we be more ‘authentic?’ (Whatever the heck that means).
How can we be more courageous and face our stupid fears, and just be a success without making everything such a huge deal?
…
We do this by forgetting ourselves.
…
Worrying about who we are and what image we project is an issue with our thinking: our minds.
You cannot fix problems of the mind at the level of the mind.
There’s no point ‘trying’ to be yourself.
‘Trying’ is thinking, and thinking will not change your mind — it will only stir it up.
It’s not going to happen until you re-direct your focus away from yourself.
Your biggest addiction isn’t the Internet, sugar, fast food or smoking.
Your biggest obsession is yourself.
…
How do you quit yourself?
You don’t. You just focus on other things.
What things?
The things that matter.
The people that matter.
Help yourself by helping others.
Improve yourself by improving the lives of others.
Learn by teaching.
Become confident by helping others be confident.
Be yourself by helping others be themselves.
Be happy by making others happy.
…
“If you want love and abundance in your life, give it away.”  — Mark Twain  …
When we make improving ourselves such a big deal, we’ve entered the labyrinth.
To free yourself from this maze, stop, breathe, and commit to making the world better.
Think today about who matters in your life.
Not everyone matters equally.
Not everyone is ready for — nor do they deserve your honesty; your wisdom; your expression. Pandering to those who do not, drain the life from us.
Who is open to your truth?
Who deserves your contribution?
Who is your tribe?
Find them, and improve their lives energetically.
Bring life, love, and value to what matters.
This will bring you more life than you knew was possible.
You will find you.
You will be yourself.
—
Make sure you follow me here and  subscribe to my newsletter  for more ideas like these, and receive my book: ‘Joining the Dots’ for free.
Originally published at  alexmathers.net  on August 27, 2017.
article.html:
Why do we care so much about what others think?

Why does it feel so damn weird to put ourselves out there?

Why does the prospect of being rejected fill us with weird vibes?

Why do we fight so hard to protect our cool, relaxed, totally not boring, happy images?

Because we’re human.

Because we don’t want to be rejected by ‘society.’

Because we want to survive.

Because it’s understandable and normal to try and look and act flawlessly.

…

The only teenie weenie issue with this is that it makes us miserable.

…

We can never relax if there is the chance that we will look stupid.

We can never just ‘be ourselves.’

So how the hell can we just relax?

How can we be more ‘authentic?’ (Whatever the heck that means).

How can we be more courageous and face our stupid fears, and just be a success without making everything such a huge deal?

…

We do this by forgetting ourselves.

…

Worrying about who we are and what image we project is an issue with our thinking: our minds.

You cannot fix problems of the mind at the level of the mind.

There’s no point ‘trying’ to be yourself.

‘Trying’ is thinking, and thinking will not change your mind — it will only stir it up.

It’s not going to happen until you re-direct your focus away from yourself.

Your biggest addiction isn’t the Internet, sugar, fast food or smoking.

Your biggest obsession is yourself.

…

How do you quit yourself?

You don’t. You just focus on other things.

What things?

The things that matter.

The people that matter.

Help yourself by helping others.

Improve yourself by improving the lives of others.

Learn by teaching.

Become confident by helping others be confident.

Be yourself by helping others be themselves.

Be happy by making others happy.

…

“If you want love and abundance in your life, give it away.” — Mark Twain

…

When we make improving ourselves such a big deal, we’ve entered the labyrinth.

To free yourself from this maze, stop, breathe, and commit to making the world better.

Think today about who matters in your life.

Not everyone matters equally.

Not everyone is ready for — nor do they deserve your honesty; your wisdom; your expression. Pandering to those who do not, drain the life from us.

Who is open to your truth?

Who deserves your contribution?

Who is your tribe?

Find them, and improve their lives energetically.

Bring life, love, and value to what matters.

This will bring you more life than you knew was possible.

You will find you.

You will be yourself.

—

Make sure you follow me here and subscribe to my newsletter for more ideas like these, and receive my book: ‘Joining the Dots’ for free.

Originally published at alexmathers.net on August 27, 2017.
article.author: Alex Mathers
article.title: How to be yourself – Personal Growth – Medium
article.summary: How can we be more courageous and face our stupid fears, and just be a success without making everything such a huge deal? Not everyone is ready for — nor do they deserve your honesty; your wisdom…

parameters.name: js
parameters.description: indicates whether to execute JavaScript or not.

parameters.name: js_timeout
parameters.description: when JavaScript is enabled, indicates how many seconds the API should wait for the JS interpreter before starting the extraction

utterances.utterance: Extract the main content from the article at https://techcrunch.com/2022/09/07/twitter-will-let-you-edit-your-tweet-up-to-five-times/
Can you get the text and media from this blog post? Here's the link: https://example.com/blog-post
I need the article content from https://news.example.com/article123, and please execute JavaScript.
Fetch the clean text from this URL: https://example.com/news-article, and set the JavaScript timeout to 45 seconds.
Extract the article from https://example.com/article and include any media.
Get the structured data from this page: https://example.com/page, without executing JavaScript.
Please extract the text from https://example.com/story and wait 60 seconds for JavaScript execution.
I need the article text from https://example.com/news, and make sure to extract any media.
Extract the content from https://example.com/article456, and execute JavaScript if necessary.
Can you get the main text from this URL: https://example.com/blog-entry, with a JavaScript timeout of 20 seconds?
